document.title: Maryland College and Career-Ready Standards - English Language Arts

827B0FB38BD94047A16C42411AABAC7C.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

79489970ADCE436FA75EE5F9F0BA605F.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

C11DF25C0266491AAE2B4AEA543477A7.description: With modeling and support from adult, recall information from experiences or information from provided sources to answer a question.

83CE1A7B3CEF4BF89441C2E5D2C1E61F.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

E9D7D90875154A0E83078B233EF12DB5.description: Participate in shared research and shared writing projects.

F1A4B761755945B6A29FE662168C606A.description: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

F28A1DE10C5C47FEBCCA3C362CEA138B.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

CB5484417B8F49558EA30484A39A3E78.description: With prompting and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to express ideas.

A436FD97538B4E8ABAE93E267F1753EB.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

D35B9801E3844A618A0A3FD6139057F7.description: With modeling, guidance, and support from adults, review drawing, dictation or developmentally appropriate writing.

1B004B08DF3B4EC5B39280BF2CBEBABB.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

E5D126EBD6354043B27B24CBD03D79C1.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to the task, purpose and audience.

43DB494135224C2FB9A5D60CF639D9F3.description: Tell about the details of the event in a meaningful sequence.

0FEEDB52D1B247869194C095E1CB9DAA.description: With modeling and support, use a combination of drawing, dictating, or developmentally appropriate writing to communicate a personal story about a single event and tell about the event in a meaningful sequence.

94977E9E85F44E21BAA2B05DC4749FBE.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.

8048574ECDBD45DCBB62B52AFC030F6F.description: Supply some facts about the topic.

E56BC81B68054CE7BF2803DE2E7DB685.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, or developmentally appropriate writing to state information on a topic.

A819669D465D4568BDF7BA9B5A6CAB92.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

BA2CBA1D01C844DE9225DB9786E02C35.description: Share an opinion on a topic or book.

A162E07D137E43D698B8158EC2BD47F2.description: Share the topic or name the book.

B017323BEDFD43C49546FCCB93978F02.description: With modeling and support, use a combination of drawing, dictating, and developmentally appropriate writing to share opinion about an experience or book.

9FBC599C12B346F6B0B92C9F3D8F9287.description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

C2EC912B3A374C78B28915F8BB5CE6FB.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversation, being read to, and responding to text.

36D6DCE0A8234250A29A33FA221744B7.description: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

A26FE43826214D7AA6B579E2C7FE7CB4.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note objects in classroom that are small).

D2E0190229A842E9A19DEA6A42343395.description: With modeling and support, demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

56F9B9C149A0466A929AEB3F9CF6412E.description: With modeling and support, sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

FA630CE485874A7A94D209969347E3B7.description: With modeling and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

8F1778F9C7994902A6A2330956247B71.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

3C2DD4ECC53A4D148C11F238A5002C55.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown words and phrases based on pre-kindergarten reading and content.

39A1A3A7C702403383109AB7B07B7437.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

42C7410B3D87462A86CC224724F6E2C5.description: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

C3579AC90C374B43AC8529CA8E380A19.description: Develop fine motor skills necessary to control and sustain handwriting.

026FBD3056314EA5824D1E088854B4AC.description: Use letter-like shapes, symbols, letters, and words to convey meaning.

8CCDEC095D734E16AA46B4433EE9B388.description: Demonstrate awareness of name and function of end punctuation (e.g., period, question mark and exclamation point).

7C2F2016B4EF41C4B86BD97CBF05C93E.description: Recognize that their name begins with a capital letter.

9A2CEE5172224041B624D662B31C170A.description: Gain exposure to conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling during shared reading and writing experiences.

D6D2959282C041B9B7B2B3DAB8380827.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

8E5A4160E23742DD970C90252522F96C.description: Produce complete sentences in shared language activities.

5A9C2B0635CD4C2F847513FA146E3189.description: Gain exposure to the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

0FC0A35828B84D94B0DAE49173F43B26.description: Understand and begin to use question words (e.g., interrogatives such as who, what, where, when, why, how).

AF2618A6FCAB4FEB8E10B332AE7EE0BB.description: Develop understanding of singular and plural nouns (e.g., dog means one dog; dogs means more than one dog).

82F5664713634556B401DE3B41AC864C.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs

4BFF9793A28A4687B4DACAC64AAD21AE.description: Print upper and lowercase letters in first name.

8EB88524482E4285A4D3DAF8EAEAE340.description: Demonstrate beginning understanding of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when engaged in literacy activities (e.g. Interactive Read Alouds, shared reading, shared writing, developmentally appropriate writing, oral language activities, etc.).

C42112BF2EA1455F801F9B63C1A4920C.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

A0C3F4831E9047B8A1E8ABBCDF7A81BF.description: With modeling and support, speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

9AB682D3F50F426887F2AD38BB059005.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

E03A912DE98A498AB73F82EBD79CD38B.description: Add drawings or visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

76D28C0482C043E5826C7E0FC7740CA2.description: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

96D22473266D442FA0A0CCE529006D73.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events with modeling and support.

74AAF69D770F44A0AD00A1491A9A0C16.description: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

FC38A9CCA112451EACEE04BA9FF6A03F.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

9289B100CCB9423BADD3866DD09C9B69.description: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

CBFF18AD7CAB4F288339E0A84131B0E6.description: Confirm understanding of text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details with modeling and support.

36DCE512331A4018A3235CC28658D8E0.description: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

1CD4B1686A974CFC9C4087FB230CC2F8.description: During scaffolded conversations, continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

A4CEFD70CE1E434498A8D9F850328D52.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns, speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

277098E5237743E0A2305CFD8C3F327B.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about pre-kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

C4A5B27B9F364FD6AF311ECD31F912F9.description: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

5C48AEA9D2E8472C877832FE0A9B51EF.description: Engage with a variety of texts (e.g., a variety of structures and/or genres) with purpose and understanding.

D3AC8B2EA019448599C073158C42B415.description: Recognize name in print as well as some environmental print (symbols/words).

BFC4493853BD475BAEDFACDF226DCEF7.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter sound correspondences by producing the most frequent sound for some consonants.

5A5594DB645A42C5A16FDB60DDC8F5C9.description: Recognize that words are made up of letters and their sounds.

1A37FA0D7E224818AD320113D77333D9.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

59D1D4DF44F14111B39D649247F6BFB5.description: Orally blend and segment individual phonemes in two- to-three phoneme words.

97E7ECC2F01743B998CBC28812C7D2D3.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial sound in spoken words.

A2C427AEE74C47A7A53CE686E4FFB7C7.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

C8F590294F0540ABB51C003D41161FF2.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

3B651498A4C34B4DB527736C3FB5C43E.description: Identify and isolate individual words in a spoken sentence.

83FA14C621CE49318552691735467191.description: Recognize rhyming words in spoken language.

5118282C655B4ECEA6BCD3940054ED26.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words and sounds (phonemes).

AB0B2F9353D7411B948843687AFF2C49.description: Recognize and name some upper and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

E0FEE092805E477090EDC91F2CD331B7.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

89ABF964E9A24CB68B3C263C10FFFCBA.description: Recognize that spoken words can be written and read.

20B76A2DB242465699EE41C1AF635FB1.description: Demonstrate an awareness that words are read from left to right, top to bottom and page by page.

476AA0901C034EA88CA4B1C84D06E403.description: Demonstrate understanding of basic features of print.

1E067B41AFD740B1B7A1FB681D778ABD.description: With prompting and support, read informational texts appropriately complex for grade 1.

5574218CEECF436F9821D5F6E2ED8478.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

D5149184B14344BBBE243B6C05FDA953.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

A2115522628E4719A493B6A74106B49D.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

BAC639A695F64ABC983F008065004983.description: With prompting and support, discuss similarities and differences between two texts on the same topic (i.e. in illustrations or descriptions).

A91CD219FA064522956DC8F8801C99BB.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

9977150601C8449F9AD165FD8DD1C6FB.description: With modeling and support identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

3AFEACCE846C4EFEBD567E9AF339EB9A.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

14117231F4D146109BF91E2CE74E8EE6.description: With modeling and support, tell how the illustrations/photographs support the text.

502E4BBE56014EB9A4A1DB95A9A01A9F.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

5585791551DF4B8EBAC3727BB592125E.description: With modeling and support define the role of the author and illustrator/photographer in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

FBA08EDAA47249DB8DF5DE6AB943B362.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

F20BC45CCEA549BD9F5277F5C07F89FD.description: With modeling and support identify the front cover, and back cover of a book.

214B197B2EBE476C98B3951B0193F774.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

1130E3B5EA6A48C0B0FF8C04D6FE4E9E.description: With modeling and support, answer questions about unknown words in a text.

A170BF92A170433A91307958652FD05C.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

F5CAF1A490A8467CB832A3D57424AFB6.description: With modeling and support, connect individuals, events, and pieces of information in text to life experiences.

7722847A1D1A42FA9FE20EA14FCE2997.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of text.

F05BAD145E0943BCB03EA1F41F9D4795.description: With modeling and support, recall one or more detail(s) related to the main topic from an informational text.

A59A38D3A591466281323BED1DF7B1A2.description: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

3F3C56FEE04C4067822CD4989FAFE2FF.description: With modeling and support, answer questions about details in an informational text.

C4ECE1372B9248B2A14EE977D4E7FC0E.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

02D1D4C3EE934FFF8E285F890DF51A88.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

0DE7BB8D145647AEB0D5805E8E54DEE1.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

8366E691D87C45C7BE3C730504BB6E69.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

9C8E4FEEF815414CA31EF0EFFD577D6D.description: With modeling and support, compare adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

5F96E641262F4D7FA2DD281BB202DB3F.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

85B00334AF454B9FAED8A11D7A072771.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

1674BA8B270144AEA8B402A8A73514C9.description: With modeling and support, tell how the illustrations support the story.

71142B6994BA4E79805153A3247498F4.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

E8133DE617CE4415B55E1ED22002CFC9.description: With modeling and support, identify the role of author and illustrator.

FE371AF949AC43D4AB67A58C52C1DD0E.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

E6F00609EF47419081E1F2A8651DFCF1.description: Gain exposure to common types of literary texts (e.g., storybooks, poems).

A6CF5ECF881B40C6AF4B0C981B3F7BA2.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

773B2232862E4F4382908C0E5ED59A74.description: With modeling and support, answer questions about unknown words in stories and poems.

C8A55859F3D040FB8230713BB632BE2C.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

0CB2684AE165412D8636377658E1DB28.description: With modeling and support, identify characters, settings and major events in a story.

78388281ADBB4E37AE420D3D63BAB077.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of text.

51ACF91C86124A5599D9C8ED853E252B.description: With modeling and support, retell familiar stories/poems.

96C2AA030C5046E5944B03953DFA1293.description: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

B18153B073C64A7AA9C7E042A2A7E938.description: With modeling and prompting, answer questions about details in a text.

9C5EE6CE04FB402E8D472F7D8DF011DE.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
